title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". Congress acknowledges the obligation for federal agencies to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which established a Government-wide goal of awarding contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Progress in meeting this goal is important. The Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans requires at least 3 percent of contracts to be awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans each fiscal year. Progress in meeting this goal has been slow, and prime contractors have an obligation to contribute. The public has a right to transparency in this matter. Progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans has been slow. Prime contractors have an obligation to help meet this goal, and the public has a right to know if it is being achieved. SEC. 3. TRANSPARENCY IN CONTRACTING GOALS FOR SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS OWNED AND CONTROLLED BY SERVICE-DISABLED VETERANS. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This includes definitions for covered contractors and Executive departments. Reports to the administrator are required three months after.
